primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The struggle of faith/humanity against the primordial chaos of death and disorder, where God acts as the boundary and transformer of that chaos.

subject.identificatie: God (as the ultimate actor) and the 'Voice of Faith' (Jesus/The Church as the active speaker).
tekstueel_bewijs: God must enter into the chaos
God comes into the deep waters at the behest of the faithful
God will come to be in the waters with us

object.identificatie: The transformation of chaos into a 'venue for communion' and the reordering of creation.
tekstueel_bewijs: transforming the waters into a place of rescuing communion
creation is reordered for new life

zender.identificatie: The Biblical Tradition/The Psalmist (The source of the 'counterspeech' values).
tekstueel_bewijs: Israel believes that its faithful speech is the earnest and harbinger of God’s own majestic intrusion
it is the voice of all our common humanity
the faithful who watch in the night
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Receiver (the one in the water) but is summoned to be a secondary Subject (the one speaking).

helper.identificatie: The 'Abrasive Speech' of faith and Jesus’ 'costly measure of obedience'.
tekstueel_bewijs: abrasive, insistent speech of faith that evokes the limit of God
Jesus... walking the last costly measure
helper.rol_van_god: God is the ultimate Subject/Power, but also the 'Safe Boundary' (Helper).

tegenstander.identificatie: Chaos / Death / Primordial Waters (manifested as greed, hate, and economic dysfunction).
tekstueel_bewijs: the powers of chaos and death are indeed untamed
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely a moral failing but 'primordial chaos' that threatens the very order of creation (S2 in the semiotic square).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human act of 'counterspeech'—refusing silence to evoke God's presence.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human speech (Secondary) is the 'harbinger' that triggers/announces God's intrusion (Primary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Biblical Promise → New Life/Communion → Sore-pressed Humanity

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will come to be in the waters with us
God comes into the deep waters
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The family pushes the evil man down

voorbeelden: chaos... must not be docilely accepted
The world now waits to see whether the faithful church can enter
who know that chaos is not normal
the power of God to curb
hope is known as power to counter chaos

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The focus is on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God vs. the 'Power' of Chaos. The human competence is shifted from 'Having to do' (Devoir) to 'Daring to speak' (Vouloir/Pouvoir) based on God's presence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Creation) to S2 (Chaos/Friday), then through ~S2 (The Limit/Speech) back to a transformed S1 (New Life/Sunday).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God enters S2 (Chaos) to transform it into the 'Jordan' (Venue for communion).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; chaos is described as 'primordial' and 'fierce'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon calls for human action ('counterspeech'), this action is a response to a cosmic battle already being won by God. God is the primary Subject of the transformation of death.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: God comes into the deep waters at the behest of the faithful

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the transformer of the situation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God will come to be in the waters with us... transforming the waters
the power of death is on the loose

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is used as the model of the 'voice of faith', but he is also the one who 'suffered for us', moving beyond mere example to substitutionary actant.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon largely avoids pure exemplarism by rooting the 'voice' in the ontological change God works in the chaos.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Moves from terror/helplessness to 'hutzpah' and trust.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology precedes and enables the 'bold speech' (Ethics/Response).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cosmic threat to the personal/communal response is tightly woven through the metaphor of 'Deep Waters'.
spanning_punten: The tension between God acting 'at the behest' of humans vs. God acting 'magisterially'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the power of death is on the loose... spending itself without finally prevailing

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'nerve called trust' is presented as a gift of the Friday-to-Sunday movement.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is linked to the 'undomesticated chaos' that threatens creation.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the cosmic rescue, avoiding the 'Helper' trap where God merely assists human effort.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might feel the 'bold speech' is a work they must generate.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Emphasize the 'Voice' as a gift of the Spirit.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Clarify that the 'counterspeech' is itself a result of being 'called by name' (Isa 43).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more Savoir (Knowledge of the Gospel).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly link the 'It is finished' to the specific historical work of Christ to ground the 'hutzpah'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Chaos) is already sufficiently terrifying.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure (Soteriology → Response) is correct.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that takes the 'Heavy Opponent' of death seriously while maintaining God's absolute Subjectivity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Deep Waters' metaphor, Greimas reveals that the water is an Actant (Opponent) that God (Subject) transforms into a Helper (Jordan).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Psalm 69; Greimas shows how the sermon re-enacts the Psalm's functional engine for a modern audience.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the 'bold speech' is not a moral work but a 'Modal Competence' (Vouloir/Pouvoir) granted by the presence of God in the chaos.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Subject-switch' where the human 'I' of the Psalm is subsumed into the 'I' of Christ, and finally into the 'I' of God's promise.
